website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight half hatchet is well-weighted and is a good value for the money.
pros: A good hiking and camping hatchet
cons: The handle on this hatchet is not as well-made as some others on the market, but you are getting a good price

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: Quality tool for the price. Hickory handle with fair grain alignment. Solid head attached tightly with no gaps. When it arrived, edge was terribly dull and full of burrs. However, about 45 minutes of stone, sand, and leather later I got a razor sharp edge on it and a better profile. Knocked some kindling out of a chopped piece of hardwood, no problem. Surprisingly effective considering how short the handle is. I wanted a hatchet that carried well on a belt and had a good hammer poll. This short handled tool fit the bill. You need to provide your own sheath, though. I would recommend this tool highly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burklund

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: Standard working hatchet for my fencing repair tool crate. Great value & quality for the price paid. USA made. Remove the stickers from handle, steel wool the finish & apply some linseed oil. The head has a varnish type coating that I removed with solvent. The edge required a bit of file & stone work which is normal for such a tool.
customer_reviews.author: tatersaladgang

customer_reviews.title: Poorly sharpened, Poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Had this a little over a year. Barely used it. the blade edge "sharp" but was honed at a really wide angle and not a great chopper. I drawered it unless I really needed to hit something to break it apart. This week, the head snapped off while chopping a rotting stump. This was definitely less than normal wear and tear. At closer inspection of the head, there didn't look like much wood holding it to begin with. Last time I buy a tool online without inspecting it personally.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: what else is there to made in the U.S.A Vaughan is my trusted tool maker been using the same 20OZ hammer from for 15 years now and now added to the work arsenal this hatch after breaking,busting splitting or what ever happen to them i decided to get what works best and built to last
customer_reviews.author: Dyfiance

customer_reviews.title: handy hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Keep it in my tool box for use on my farm. Hammer, split wood for the stove, pull nails,and a hundred other uses
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great for pounding in staples or cutting a tree branch
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to use in our fencing box...great for pounding in staples or cutting a tree branch. 22 oz. is just the right weight!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Murray

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little hatchet. You probably will have to sharpen it on arrival but that's not a big deal. I used a standard knife sharpener and it worked great. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Axe throwing
customer_reviews.text: We have used this Axe over 100 times for Axe throwing, Unbelievable well made, this Axe is a great buy!!! Super pleased. Ordering more for our Axe league friends!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this Tool and even more that it is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best hatchet I've found
customer_reviews.text: As close to Grandpas old hatchet (which by the way I can't get a handle for) as I've ever seen . Love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: everything you want in this type of product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. good strong handle and great craftsmanship. Came with a decent edge.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its alright, part of the cars bug out kit not for everyday use
customer_reviews.author: PAUL NORTHUP

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Well built and as advertised. Will be using it to split 2 x 4 and 2 x 6 inch pine and fur for kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Feador

customer_reviews.title: Carpenters Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet for camping. We use it for tent stakes, chopping kindling,
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little addition for the fireplace tools set.
customer_reviews.text: Great little hatchet and is good for managing all the wood going into your fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Great all round hatchet for a very reasonable price. Should last a lifetime. I will be using this hatchet for fire wood and rough timber framing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nalbone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Adequate packaging
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Adequate packaging. Be sure to file off the heavy layer of PU applied to the edge prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my boyfriend for Christmas he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: I got the hatchets for groomsmen gifts which I then ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the hatchets for groomsmen gifts which I then wood burned the handles. Half match it was much lighter than I thought and overall very well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with the head falling off like other reviewers. Overall it's a great little hatchet and I use it mostly for collecting firewood. No need to go for a more expensive one. It's got a great weight to it and a sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed about that but will live with it
customer_reviews.text: The head wasn't hung completely on to the handle. I was disappointed about that but will live with it. I had to spend sometime with a file and stone sharpening the edge so the tool is now shaving sharp. But otherwise satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hatchet, I used it to cut fire wood ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible hatchet, I used it to cut fire wood into smaller pieces and after a few logs cut smaller the head of the hatchet broke clean off. Horrible build quality
customer_reviews.author: brandon price

customer_reviews.title: Nice hack job!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little hatchet for the money. I've used it primarily when camping to pound tent stakes, chop kindling, and clear small branches and brush. It seems to be of good quality materials and feels very solid in the hand during use. I have several other hatchets but this one may be my all-around favorite. It is also nice to know it's made in the USA too! Good job Vaughn.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Flick

customer_reviews.title: Good little utility hatchet for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Good little utility hatchet for a decent price. It's not a Gransfors Bruk by any means, but for literally one-fifth the price it handles splitting, shingles, and small chores decently. I've had trouble finding a decent leather cover for a reasonable price, though (using a piece of garden hose to protect the blade instead).
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Wingard

customer_reviews.title: ... a standard old hatchet and this is a very sturdy hatchet. It sharpens well and works great for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always favored a carpenters hatchet over a standard old hatchet and this is a very sturdy hatchet. It sharpens well and works great for splitting starter wood for camp fires.
customer_reviews.author: Sur-Shot

product_meta.title: Vaughan SH2 22-Ounce Carpenters Half Hatchet, Flame Treated Hickory Handle, 13-Inch Long.
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack of 1Forged from American made, high carbon steel with a fully polished head and a 3-1/2? cut with an American hickory handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
SH2 Carpenter's Half Hatchet has fully a polished head. 3 1/2" cut. Fine, flame treated hickory handle. A fine, standard weight tool for construction trades or handyman.
feature_bullets: Forged entirely of high quality, high carbon steel
Beveled nail slot in polished head
Extra large, crowned striking face for accurate power blows
